newsitem.title: USA: U.S. FERC to review Duke, PanEnergy merger May 28.
newsitem.headline: U.S. FERC to review Duke, PanEnergy merger May 28.

text.p: The U.S. Federal Energy Regulatory Commission is set to discuss the proposed merger of Duke Power Co and PanEnergy Corp at its meeting on May 28, according to an agenda released Thursday.

The $7.7 billion merger to form Duke Energy Corp, first announced last November, would form one of the largest U.S. energy and energy services companies preparing for the opening of local power markets to competition.
This is the second merger of an electric utility with a natural gas company the FERC is set to consider.
The commission in February approved the merger of Enron Corp with Portland General Corp.

It based its decision then on the fact that the two companies had no big overlap of assets that would allow them to control the western power market and that they had agreed to freeze their wholesale rates for four years.

Pending approval from the FERC, PanEnergy and Duke Power expect to close their deal in the third quarter of this year, PanEnergy Chairman Paul Anderson said last month after the companies' shareholders approved the union.
